stimulusHtml: Which of the following statements best describes the time it takes for the two types of radiation from the supernova to reach Earth?

features.html: A supernova (an explosion of a massive star) occurs at a distance of 2 Ã— 10 20 m from Earth. The supernova simultaneously emits radiation at both visible and x-ray wavelengths.

choicesHtml: The two types of radiation reach Earth at approximately the same time, within a few seconds of the supernova explosion.
The two types of radiation reach Earth at approximately the same time, many years after the supernova explosion.
The two types of radiation reach Earth many years after the supernova explosion, but the visible radiation arrives first due to its shorter wavelength.
The two types of radiation reach Earth many years after the supernova explosion, but the x-ray radiation arrives first due to its shorter wavelength.
